alert.note: Alert for Spokane Area; Upper Columbia Basin; Washington Palouse (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 8:26AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Adams, northeastern Whitman, southeastern Lincoln and southwestern Spokane Counties through 900 AM PDT... At 825 AM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northwest of Colfax, or 24 miles northwest of Pullman, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Garfield, St. John, Sprague, Oakesdale, Endicott, Malden, Lamont, Steptoe, Revere, Belmont, Diamond, Thornton, Dusty, Pine City, Marengo, Winona, Ewen, and Ewan. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 in Washington between mile markers 239 and 253. U.S. Highway 195 in Washington between mile markers 41 and 61. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Spokane Area; Upper Columbia Basin; Washington Palouse
